intro: Urostachys haleakalae, commonly known as the Haleakalā tephrosia, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and slender stems. The plant thrives in moist, shaded habitats, typically found in coastal areas and upland forests. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is listed as endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival. Its unique ecological role and limited distribution highlight its importance in Hawaiian biodiversity.
